TextLibrary.Text: Khrona
Gruulkar is starting to gather the Orcish horde again. It looks like war.
Gruulkar is starting to gather the Orcish horde again. It looks like war.
Gruulkar is starting to gather the Orcish horde again. It looks like war.
Gruulkar is starting to gather the Orcish horde again. It looks like war.
I thought I had taken care of this. I quieted the Orcs around Dhun-Kor, and then I defeated the Ogres. Why does Gruulkar insist on going to war?
I thought I had taken care of this. I quieted the Orcs around Dhun-Kor, and then I defeated the Ogres. Why does Gruulkar insist on going to war?
I thought I had taken care of this. I quieted the Orcs around Dhun-Kor, and then I defeated the Ogres. Why does Gruulkar insist on going to war?
I thought I had taken care of this. I quieted the Orcs around Dhun-Kor, and then I defeated the Ogres. Why does Gruulkar insist on going to war?
It was unavoidable, I'm afraid. Since Dugog's death, northern Kor has become unstable. The Orcs around here have no clear leader, and Gruulkar looks to expand his empire and grab control of them.
It was unavoidable, I'm afraid. Since Dugog's death, northern Kor has become unstable. The Orcs around here have no clear leader, and Gruulkar looks to expand his empire and grab control of them.

It was unavoidable, I'm afraid. Since Dugog's death, northern Kor has become unstable. The Orcs around here have no clear leader, and Gruulkar looks to expand his empire and grab control of them.
Very well. I'll go and talk to Gruulkar; maybe I can stop him. I am also convinced he knows more about the slaves than he told me before.

It will require more than talk to convince Gruulkar.

Believe me... I'll do whatever it takes.
